document_notes.text:
This update for rubygem-actionview-5_1 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-27777: Fixed possible cross-site scripting vulnerability in Action View tag helpers (bsc#1199060).
- CVE-2020-15169: Fixed cross-site scripting in translation helpers (bsc#1176421).
- CVE-2020-8167: Fixed CSRF vulnerability in rails-ujs (bsc#1172184).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: In Action View before versions 5.2.4.4 and 6.0.3.3 there is a potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Action View's translation helpers. Views that allow the user to control the default (not found) value of the `t` and `translate` helpers could be susceptible to XSS attacks. When an HTML-unsafe string is passed as the default for a missing translation key named html or ending in _html, the default string is incorrectly marked as HTML-safe and not escaped. This is patched in versions 6.0.3.3 and 5.2.4.4. A workaround without upgrading is proposed in the source advisory.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: A CSRF vulnerability exists in rails <= 6.0.3 rails-ujs module that could allow attackers to send CSRF tokens to wrong domains.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: A XSS Vulnerability in Action View tag helpers >= 5.2.0 and < 5.2.0 which would allow an attacker to inject content if able to control input into specific attributes.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
